issue.title: Add `.live` support to modeable
issue.body:
This PR adds support for `.live` to modelable, allowing you to do `<livewire:child wire:model.live="foo" />` and the parent will update reactively when the child updates.

Definitely open to ideas on how to improve the implementation of this PR, but I thought I'd push it up as it currently works.

comment.body: Changed to draft as there are failing tests

pull_request.title: Add live support to modeable
pull_request.body:
This PR adds support for `.live` to modelable, allowing you to do `<livewire:child wire:model.live="foo" />` and the parent will update reactively when the child updates.

Definitely open to ideas on how to improve the implementation of this PR, but I thought I'd push it up as it currently works.

pull_request.title: Update modelable to support numeric array keys
pull_request.body: Currently, if you have a numeric array in a parent component and try to use modelable to bind it to a child component ``, it throws this error: This is because javascript doesn't support using dot notation to access array indexes. So `items.0.name` won't work, and needs to be changed to `items[0].name`. This PR fixes this by changing any key indexes to array notation just before we output `x-model` and `x-modelable` on the root element. Hope this helps!

commits.message:
Utilize PHPUnit\Framework\TestCase class to broaden compatibility with other packages (#7075)

* Utilize `PHPUnit\Framework\TestCase` class to broaden compatibility with other packages

* Pass the `$method` parameter to ensure compatibility with PHPUnit v10

* Support both PHPUnit 9 and PHPUnit 10

Co-authored-by: Mior Muhammad Zaki <crynobone@gmail.com>

---------

Co-authored-by: Mior Muhammad Zaki <crynobone@gmail.com>

pull_request.title: Utilize PHPUnit\Framework\TestCase class to broaden compatibility with other packages
pull_request.body:
Enhanced Compatibility with Other Packages Utilizing `PHPUnit\Framework\TestCase` Class **1️⃣ Is this something that is wanted/needed? Did you create a discussion about it first?** Yes, enhancing compatibility is always beneficial as it promotes interoperability with a wider array of packages. No discussion was created. **2️⃣ Did you create a branch for your fix/feature? (Master branch PR's will be closed)** Yes, a separate branch named `add-testcase-compatibility` has been created for this purpose. **3️⃣ Does it contain multiple, unrelated changes? Please separate the PRs out.** No, this PR solely focuses on enhancing compatibility by utilizing the `PHPUnit\Framework\TestCase` class. **4️⃣ Does it include tests? (Required)** No, existing tests continue to pass with these changes, serving primarily to extend compatibility with other packages/projects, ensuring seamless integration as they evolve. **5️⃣ Please include a thorough description (including small code snippets if possible) of the improvement and reasons why it's useful.** Testing Livewire components or integrations within packages can sometimes pose challenges. This PR aims to streamline this process, enabling developers to leverage the Livewire testing infrastructure for a broader range of testing scenarios. This change is fairly straightforward yet significantly impactful. ```php Livewire::visit(new class() extends Component { public $color = '#000'; public function render(): string { return <<<'BLADE'
BLADE; } }) ->waitForAlpineJs() ->assertInputValue('color', '#000'); ``` By adhering to PHPUnit's native TestCase class, we foster a more standardized approach, which in turn facilitates integration with other packages. This is particularly useful for projects that rely on a variety of packages and aim for a cohesive working environment. Thanks for this awesome package! 🙌

commits.message: Add default to $progressBar for scriptConfig approach (#7158)

pull_request.title: Fix: Alpine is not defined when using @livewireScriptConfig and show_progress_bar = false
pull_request.body:
This fixes an issue where:

1) inject_assets is false (and livewireScriptConfig is used
and
2) navigate.show_progress_bar is false in config
```
    'navigate' => [
        'show_progress_bar' => false,
    ],
```

At present (last checked 3.0.10), this will result in an error:
_Uncaught ReferenceError: Alpine is not defined_

The fix uses the same logic as the standard js() method for injection, to ensure that a value is returned to 
```
$progressBar
```
Which is used in the generation of the script include for Livewire.

Without this fix, code output for 
```
@livewireScriptConfig 
```
is:
```
<script data-navigate-once="true">window.livewireScriptConfig = {"csrf":"zAK7ZGN5e3tqL1cNhjH3gwNC6J4DFASgaatoPD7P","uri":"\/livewire\/update","progressBar":false};</script>
```
With Fix:
```
<script data-navigate-once="true">window.livewireScriptConfig = {"csrf":"zAK7ZGN5e3tqL1cNhjH3gwNC6J4DFASgaatoPD7P","uri":"\/livewire\/update","progressBar":"data-no-progress-bar"};</script> 
```

The key difference being the "progressBar" parameter.

Review the contribution guide first at: https://laravel-livewire.com/docs/2.x/contribution-guide

1️⃣ Is this something that is wanted/needed? Did you create a discussion about it first?

2️⃣ Did you create a branch for your fix/feature? (Master branch PR's will be closed)

3️⃣ Does it contain multiple, unrelated changes? Please separate the PRs out.

4️⃣ Does it include tests? (Required)

5️⃣ Please include a thorough description (including small code snippets if possible) of the improvement and reasons why it's useful.

Thanks for contributing! 🙌


**Minimal testing has been performed however!**
